DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the patient consented to this sample collection.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to patient consent specimen collection.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Permission to do something.:A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: gathering or assemblage of a part of something intended as a representative of the whole; for physical samples such as soil, microorganisms, chemicals, blood, etc.; do not confuse with DATA COLLECTION.

Concepts.definition: gathering or assemblage of a part of something intended as a representative of the whole; for physical samples such as soil, microorganisms, chemicals, blood, etc.; do not confuse with DATA COLLECTION.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to this sample collection

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent for collection of tissue samples

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Tissue/Blood obtained at progression (if occurs) kept for cancer research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Tissue/Blood obtained at progression (if occurs) kept for medical research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to 'tumor tissue for ALK testing' sample collection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient signed consent for tissue research

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient sign a consent form for tissue research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to use of tumor sample(s) for ALK testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the participant agree to have their specimen collected and agree that their specimen sample(s) (rectal biopsy/swab, urine, stool and blood) and related information may be used for the laboratory study(ies) described above?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP-text-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: I agree to the breast core biopsy procedures, and to have my specimen collected and I agree that my specimen sample(s) and related information may be used for research studies described above.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NCIP Text-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent for collection of stool samples

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP-Text-2
ReferenceDocuments.description: The participant agreed to the breast core biopsy procedures and that their breast biopsy specimen sample(s) and related information may be used for research studies described above.
